question: # Q1. Teams may encounter the need for "technical" user stories. Who decides the priority of these?
options: the Product Owner with help from Operations
the Tech Lead with help from the Product Owner
the Product Owner with help from the Tech Lead
the Tech Lead with help from Operations
answerText: the Product Owner with help from the Tech Lead

question: # Q2. What is the Scrum Master's role during the daily stand-up?
options: Congratulate the team on their great work.
Stand outside the circle of developers and listen for impediments.
The Scrum Master should not attend—this meeting is for developers only.
Ask each developer what they did since the last daily standup.
answerText: Stand outside the circle of developers and listen for impediments.

question: # Q3. Which factor should not be considered during Sprint Planning?
options: the team's velocity
the number of stories in the product backlog
the stories that are ready
the team's capacity
answerText: the number of stories in the product backlog

question: # Q4. A team member has been showing signs of great personal distress: crying at work, snapping at colleagues, having heated phone conversations. As Team Facilitator, what should you do?
options: Give the team member space and time to deal with their personal issues.
Tell the others on the team that their teammate needs some emotional support.
Notify the team member's manager of your observations and ask the manager for help.
Ask the team member if they would like to talk about what might be going on with them personally.
answerText: Notify the team member's manager of your observations and ask the manager for help.

question: # Q5. Which statement describes the flow of work in the Scaled Agile Framework?
options: It is a "push" system.
It is "push" at the top and "pull" at the bottom.
It is a "pull" system.
It is neither "push" nor "pull."
answerText: It is neither "push" nor "pull."

question: # Q6. What is the Product Owner's role in deciding the priority of work in the sprint backlog?
options: None—the Scrum Master should prioritize the work in the sprint backlog.
The PO should prioritize the items in the sprint backlog.
The developers prioritize work unless they cannot complete it, in which case the PO should prioritize the remaining work.
None—the developers should prioritize the work in the sprint backlog.
answerText: None—the developers should prioritize the work in the sprint backlog.

question: # Q7. The Scaled Agile Framework advocates that, if you measure only one thing, what should you measure?
options: quality
predictability of delivery
cost of delay
return on investment
answerText: cost of delay

question: # Q8. Why should you apply Weighted Shortest Job First?
options: to maximize the return on investment
to determine the economic sequencing of the backlog
to visualize queue length
to fulfill a commitment to quality

Weighted Shortest Job First (WSJF) is a prioritization model used to sequence jobs (eg., Features, Capabilities, and Epics) to produce the maximum economic benefit. In a flow-based system, priorities are updated continuously to provide the best economic outcomes. Job sequencing, rather than individual job return on investment, produces the best result. To that end, WSJF is used to prioritize backlogs by calculating the relative CoD and job size (a proxy for the duration). [(Source)](https://www.scaledagileframework.com/wsjf/)
answerText: to determine the economic sequencing of the backlog

question: # Q9. You have classified the features in your backlog according to risk and value. Which features should the development team work on first?
options: low-value and high-risk
high-value and high-risk
high-value and low-risk
low-value and low-risk

It is suggested that high business value, high-risk items are worked on first. While that may seem counterintuitive, the earlier this work is done, the sooner the team will move to mitigate the issues and unknowns—leading to a higher quality product. If there's a failure, it will occur early and relatively inexpensively. [(Source)](https://agilescrumguide.com/blog/files/tag-product-backlog---business-value-and-risk.html)
answerText: high-value and high-risk

question: # Q10. In the Scaled Agile Framework, what is the role of Enablers?
options: They help extend the Architectural Runway.
They connect vision to mission so the organization can be successful.
They support team building.
They remove the impediments to quality.
answerText: They help extend the Architectural Runway.

question: # Q11. Which outcome is not expected of a Sprint Review?
options: The team demonstrates its completed work.
The team reflects on how to improve its performance.
Items in the backlog may be reprioritized.
Stakeholders give feedback about the work completed.
answerText: The team reflects on how to improve its performance.

question: # Q12. What is not a technique used for splitting user stories?
options: split by line-of-business
split compound user stories
split by alternative paths
split by interface
answerText: split compound user stories

question: # Q13. Who decides what the team will work on?
options: the Scrum Master
a self-organizing team
the Product Owner
the Product Manager
answerText: a self-organizing team

question: # Q14. Which choice is not a Scrum value?
options: focus
integrity
courage
commitment
answerText: integrity

question: # Q15. What should happen if the Product Owner does not accept a story by the end of the iteration?
options: The team does not get credit for the story's points in its velocity calculation.
The story should be sliced to reflect the work completed.
The acceptance criteria should be adjusted to reflect the work completed.
The story should be shown to stakeholders for their feedback.
answerText: The story should be shown to stakeholders for their feedback.

question: # Q16. Which statement is not true about the product backlog?
options: It is a list of work items that are behind schedule.
The items are maintained in priority order.
Anyone on the team can propose an item for it.
It includes all of the work to be done.
answerText: It is a list of work items that are behind schedule.

question: # Q17. A project has some major risks that the team wants to mitigate. What is the best way to monitor how well this effort is going?
options: risk-based spike
risk-adjusted backlog
risk velocity chart
risk burndown graph
answerText: risk burndown graph

question: # Q18. The VP of engineering wants to start a Team Member of the Sprint Award to recognize a top performer in each group. What would you advise the VP?
options: This is not a good idea unless there has been recent employee feedback that people feel underappreciated.
It is a good idea as long as a different person is recognized in each sprint.
It is a good idea because awards can motivate people to do their best.
This is not a good idea because it can destroy the team unity that is essential to achieving high performance.
answerText: This is not a good idea because it can destroy the team unity that is essential to achieving high performance.

question: # Q19. What is a difference between a team's task board and a Kanban?
options: A Kanban has an explicit rule to limit WIP. (explicit rule applies to scrum team's task board: tasks cannot be added to the scrum board in the middle of a sprint)
A Kanban shows the backlog of work.
A Kanban does not use a Definition of Done.
A Kanban shows the status of the work items.
[(Source)](https://www.lucidchart.com/blog/kanban-vs-scrum#:~:text=Both%20boards%20are%20used%20to,can%20be%20more%20easily%20adapted.)
answerText: A Kanban has an explicit rule to limit WIP. (explicit rule applies to scrum team's task board: tasks cannot be added to the scrum board in the middle of a sprint)

question: # Q20. The team complains that "things have been falling through the cracks lately." What should you do?
options: Ask the team's manager to make role assignments so the team can catch up.
Conduct a workshop to identify all of the things that need to be done and see who can help with each.
Refer to the team's RACI (Responsible, Accountable, Consulted, Informed) assignments.
Meet with the Tech Lead and Product Owner to try to identify what can be done.
answerText: Conduct a workshop to identify all of the things that need to be done and see who can help with each.

question: # Q21. In Large-Scale Scrum, what is the recommended ratio of Scrum Masters to teams?
options: One Scrum Master can support up to five teams.
Large teams should have two Scrum Masters.
There should be one Scrum Master per team.
One Scrum Master can support one to three teams.
answerText: One Scrum Master can support one to three teams.

question: # Q22. In the Cynefin framework, where are "best practices" most appropriate?
options: in the Complex regime
in the Complicated regime
in the Chaotic regime
in the Obvious regime
answerText: in the Obvious regime

question: # Q23. A manager informs you that a developer from another team is between assignments, and she wants to place the developer on your team for a few sprints. What should you do?
options: Explain to the manager that this will be disruptive to the team and ask that another assignment be found.
Explain the situation to the team and ask them to go with the flow.
Explain the situation to your manager and ask them to resolve it.
When the temporary developer shows up, assign them to write documentation.
answerText: Explain to the manager that this will be disruptive to the team and ask that another assignment be found.

question: # Q24. The Product Owner complains to you that the team is not working hard enough and they need to increase their velocity by at least 50%. Which action should you not take?
options: Share the feedback from the PO and challenge the team to increase their velocity.
Ask the PO to explain the business context to the team.
Explain the impact of technical debt to the PO and the benefits of devoting some capacity to reducing it.
Hold a Value Stream Mapping workshop to identify and reduce waste.
answerText: Share the feedback from the PO and challenge the team to increase their velocity.

question: # Q25. What is the name of the practice in which a cross-functional team collaborates intensively to develop a new product idea?
options: Hackathon
Scrum at Scale
Innovation and Planning
Magnum Focus
answerText: Hackathon

question: # Q26. The team's manager wants to attend the Sprint Retrospective. What should you do?
options: Agree to the manager's request and notify the team.
Propose that the manager attend only every other retrospective.
Propose a different forum for the manager to meet with the team.
Ask the team if it is okay with them that the manager attend.
answerText: Propose a different forum for the manager to meet with the team.

question: # Q27. Who is responsible for a Scrum team's performance?
options: the team
the Scrum Master
the Product Owner
the Engineering Manager
answerText: the team

question: # Q28. Which statement concerning small, frequent releases of software is true?
options: The chance for rollback is high.
It typically requires a high degree of automation.
The administrative costs are high.
Backward compatibility may be jeopardized.
answerText: It typically requires a high degree of automation.

question: # Q29. What is the activity of clarifying and expanding user stories called?
options: story point estimating
Definition of Done
user story expansion
backlog refinement
answerText: backlog refinement

question: # Q30. Which strategy is preferred for development teams?
options: Optimize for most work done.
Maximize output and maximize outcome.
Maximize outcome while minimizing output.
Optimize for resource utilization.
answerText: Maximize output and maximize outcome.

question: # Q31. Which statement is true about the actor in a user story?
options: The actor does not have to be a specified role in the solution.
There must be multiple personas for each actor.
The actor can be the system itself.
The system cannot be the actor.
answerText: The actor can be the system itself.

question: # Q32. Which statement is true about Agile?
options: Agile requires a high degree of up-front planning.
Once the requirements are agreed to, the team can complete work.
Agile requires a high degree of discipline.
Agile works best when there is no contract.
answerText: Agile requires a high degree of discipline.

question: # Q33. Which statement about burndown and burnup charts is not true?
options: Burndown charts show the work remaining to be done.
Burnup charts show the work completed.
Burndown charts are more useful than burnup charts.
Agile project management tools can produce these automatically.
answerText: Burndown charts are more useful than burnup charts.

question: # Q34. What is the name for the practice of going to see a process in use at the point of value delivery?
options: Six Sigma
Gemba walk
Total Quality Management
Kaizen
answerText: Gemba walk

question: # Q35. When the team needs to make a decision, what is the best course of action?
options: Try to achieve concensus.
Take a vote and the majority rules.
Identify the person who is most knowledgeable and ask them to decide.
Let the most senior member of the team decide.
answerText: Try to achieve concensus.

question: # Q36. Which action is something the Team Facillitator should NOT do?
options: Embrace servant leadership.
Estimate story points.
Celebrate successes.
Remove impediments
answerText: Estimate story points.

question: # Q37. A team needs to do research, design, prototyping. What is this type of story called?
options: Exploratory spike
Backlog refinement
Functional decomposition
R&D
answerText: Exploratory spike

question: # Q38. Which statement about technical debt is true?
options: Technical debt is another name for bugs
It is at the Product Owner's description to allocate effort to reduce technical debt.
Adding technical debt should be avoided at all costs.
Technical debt is what the Product Owner owes to the developers if they work a lot of overtime to complete the sprint.
answerText: Adding technical debt should be avoided at all costs.

question: # Q39. Which statement about estimating is not true?
options: Absolute estimating is more reliable than relative estimating.
Relative estimating is more reliable than absolute estimating.
In estimating, accuracy is more important than precision.
In estimating, the effort is more important than the time required.
answerText: In estimating, accuracy is more important than precision.

question: # Q40. Which ceremony should the Product Owner not attend?
options: daily stand-ups
Sprint Retrospectives
story point estimating
code reviews
answerText: code reviews

question: # Q41. Which task is not the Product Owners responsibility?
options: estimating story points
refining acceptance criteria
giving feedback to developers about the user stories
demonstrating the work to stakeholders
answerText: giving feedback to developers about the user stories

question: # Q42. Which choice is `_not_` considered during Sprint Planning?
options: stories that meet the Definition of Done
team velocity
stories that meet the Definition of Ready
team capacity
answerText: stories that meet the Definition of Done

question: # Q43. You have noticed a pattern that the most interesting stories on the Sprint Backlog get started right away, and the least interesting stories languish or don't get done. What should you do?
options: Use a lottery system assign each story.
Share your observation with the team and invite them to own and solve the problem.
During story point estimation increase the points assigned to the least interesting stories so the team can boost their velocity.
Ask the Tech Lead to assign every story to a developer so they all get done efficiently and with accountability.
answerText: Ask the Tech Lead to assign every story to a developer so they all get done efficiently and with accountability.

question: # Q44. What Agile practice best supports this principle: "At regular intervals, the team reflects on how to become more effective, then tunes and adjusts its behavior accordingly"?
options: Sprint Review
Sprint Retrospective
daily stand-up
Sprint Demo
answerText: Sprint Retrospective

question: # Q45. On what are personas typically based?
options: a sponsors or team members' personalities and traits
what the developers think is user friendly
real people, archetypal users, or composites of multiple users
descriptions of the product's functionality and use
answerText: real people, archetypal users, or composites of multiple users

question: # Q46. Which statement describes Shu Ha Ri?
options: It is a library of coding patterns.
It is a software testing strategy.
It is a standard for interface design.
It is a model for skill development and mastery.
answerText: It is a model for skill development and mastery.

question: # Q47. What does the Agile Manifesto indicate?
options: Responding to change is more valuable than following a plan.
Documenting requirements up front is more valuable than at the end.
Following the plan is essential for not going over budget.
Contract negotiation should be used to settle disputes.
answerText: Responding to change is more valuable than following a plan.

question: # Q48. What is the main benefit of a working agreement?
options: It specifies core working hours.
It clarifies the reporting relationships on the team.
It defines the culture that the team aspires to achieve.
It compiles everyone's information.
answerText: It defines the culture that the team aspires to achieve.

question: # Q49. What is the name of the information radiator that has multiple columns used to visualize the flow of work?
options: Work Flow Indicator
Value Stream Map
Story Map
Kanban Board
answerText: Kanban Board

question: # Q50. Which is the best definition of story points?
options: They are a relative measure of the effort needed to complete a story.
They a measure of development time only, test time is considered separately.
They are a relative measure of the value of a story.
They are a measure of time to complete a story.
answerText: They are a relative measure of the effort needed to complete a story.

question: # Q51. What is a Scrum of Scrums?
options: It is technique for two or more teams working together coordinate their efforts.
It is another name for the Scrum Master Community of Practice.
It is an information radiator used to compare the velocity of several teams.
It is the system demo for teams on the same release train.
answerText: It is technique for two or more teams working together coordinate their efforts.

question: # Q52. What is the Product Owner's role regarding the product backlog?
options: The PO must identify the intended users of the features on the backlog.
The PO is responsible for estimating the size of the total.
The PO must identify the dependencies that impact the backlog.
The PO decides what to include in the backlog and what to exclude.
answerText: The PO must identify the dependencies that impact the backlog.

question: # Q53. Why should a team do refactoring?
options: It assigns developers to other teams in order to eliminate personality conflicts.
It improves the functionality of the product,
It recalibrates the success criteria for the product in the marketplace.
It improves the design, which can lead improved development efficiency and maintainability.
answerText: It improves the design, which can lead improved development efficiency and maintainability.

question: # Q54. Which choice is not a benefit generally associated with product demonstrations?
options: Learn about new requirements.
Learn feature suitability.
Learn about feature usability.
Learn about feature estimates.
answerText: Learn about feature estimates.

question: # Q55. What is an information radiator?
options: a list of KPIs for the team
a list of overdue action items
the task board
a highly visible display of key performance data
answerText: the task board

question: # Q56. According to the Agile Manifesto, your highest priority is to `**\_\_**`.
options: minimize change requests
satisfy the customer
get the job done on time
achieve the desired ROI
answerText: satisfy the customer

question: # Q57. Product development organizations sometimes use descriptions of archetypal users and their values so that developers can design the system to meet their needs and wants. What are these descriptions called?
options: actors
roles
agents
personas
answerText: personas

question: # Q58. The Product Owner is focused on testing a new system concept in the marketplace as quickly and inexpensively as possible. What is this first-generation product called?
options: preproduction version
focus group demonstrator
Generation 1 product
minimum viable product
answerText: minimum viable product

question: # Q59. To whom should the Product Owner report?
options: the Quality Manager
the Product Manager
the Scrum Master
the Engineering Manager
answerText: the Product Manager

question: # Q60. What happens in Sprint 0?
options: The team delivers no story points in that sprint.
The team does regression testing prior to release to production.
The team prepares to work on the product backlog.
This is the time to inspect and adapt.
answerText: The team prepares to work on the product backlog.

question: # Q61. What does the Definition of Done mean?
options: The story meets the INVEST criteria.
The team has completed all of the work in its Sprint.
The story has been handed off to the DevOps team.
The team has agreed on the criteria for story completion.
answerText: The team has agreed on the criteria for story completion.

question: # Q62. Which element is most important when describing your product?
options: its cost
its licensing terms and conditions
its benefits
its features
answerText: its benefits

question: # Q63. Which choice best describes the Team Facilitator?
options: a meeting scheduler
a record keeper
a project manager
an Agile coach
answerText: an Agile coach

question: # Q64. What is the name of the technique that divides a story into smaller pieces?
options: mitosis
story slicing
disaggregation
Divide and Conquer
answerText: disaggregation

question: # Q65. A team member comes to you with a complaint about another team member. What should you do?
options: Bring the complaint to the other person and try to resolve the issue.
Ask them to talk to the other person and try to work it.
Notify HR of the problem and ask them to handle it.
Invite both people a meeting and try mediate the conflict.
answerText: Invite both people a meeting and try mediate the conflict.

question: # Q66. What is the forming-storming-norming, performing model of team development known as?
options: the Tuckman model
the Standard Team model
Moore's Team Framework
the Siebert model
answerText: the Tuckman model

question: # Q67. What is the name of the ceremony in which you inspect the work completed during the sprint?
options: Sprint Retrospective (reflect on the previous sprint, discuss what’s working well, what could be improved, and how to improve it to be more productive)
Sprint Review (discuss what has been accomplished during the sprint and whether the sprint goal has been met)
Next-Sprint Planning
Velocity Confirmation
[(Source)](https://startinfinity.com/product-management-framework/scrum-sprint/sprint-review-vs-sprint-retrospective)
answerText: Sprint Review (discuss what has been accomplished during the sprint and whether the sprint goal has been met)

question: # Q68. Which choice best describes an Agile Release Train (ART)?
options: continuous delivery
comprised of the teams within a program
DevOps Center of Excellence
Scrum of Scrums
answerText: continuous delivery

question: # Q69. As an Agile coach, what should be your attitude toward your team members individual goals and motivations?
options: Understand them—try align personal motivations with the team's progress toward the project goals.
Nurture them-goals are the reason why people want to be at work.
Disregard them—personal views have no bearing on reaching the project goals.
Leverage them—use personal goals encourage team members raise their performance levels.
answerText: Leverage them—use personal goals encourage team members raise their performance levels.

question: # Q70. Which phrase best describes an Agile team?
options: self-directed
self-managed
self-sustaining
self-organizing
answerText: self-organizing

question: # Q71. Which technique does not help prioritize the backlog?
options: MoSCow
Kano
WSJF
Kaizen
answerText: Kaizen

question: # Q72. What does the Definition of Ready mean?
options: The story has been tested end is ready for release to production.
The story is ready to be brought into a sprint.
The stakeholders are ready to discuss their requirements for story.
The team has completed sprint 0 and is ready to work.

Definition of Ready means that stories must be immediately actionable. The Team must be able to determine what needs to be done and the amount of work required to complete the User Story.  [(Source)](https://www.scruminc.com/definition-of-ready/#:~:text=Having%20a%20Definition%20of%20Ready,the%20User%20Story%20or%20PBI.)
answerText: The story is ready to be brought into a sprint.

question: # Q73. Which is NOT a principle of the Scaled Agile Framework?
options: Centralize decision-making
Apply systems thinking
Take an economic view
Unlock the intrinsic motivation of knowledge workers
answerText: Unlock the intrinsic motivation of knowledge workers

question: # Q74. Which statement concerning small, frequent releases of software is true?
options: The chance for rollback is high
It typically requires a high degree of automation
Backward compatibility may be jeopardized
The administrative costs are high
answerText: It typically requires a high degree of automation

question: # Q75. What is the definition of capacity?
options: It is an inventory of the team's knowledge and skills that is used to plan the work that they do.
It is the number of teams that a Team Facilitator can support concurrently.
It is an adjustment to velocity, used in Spring Planning, to account for reduced availability of team members during the upcoming sprint.
It is the maximum number of stories that will be allowed in a sprint.
answerText: It is the maximum number of stories that will be allowed in a sprint.

question: # Q76. Which action is something the Team Facilitator should not do?
options: Celebrate Success.
Embrace servant leadership.
Remove impediments
Estimate story points.
answerText: Estimate story points.
